website_summaries.verdict: Reception and signal quality are a bit mixed, with weather and the antenna’s construction playing a role in how many stations are pulled in.
pros: Does a very good job picking up HD signals when pointed correctly at towers
Signal can be split several ways without additional amplification
cons: Mounting can be a minor challenge for inexperienced owners
Rainwater can get into antenna components

website_summaries.verdict: An included mounting mast, good warranty service, and excellent reception put this outdoor antenna at the top of our list.
pros: Signal can be split without additional amplification
Reception is acceptable even w/buildings blocking direct line of sight and attic or indoor installation
cons: Some reports of poor reception at less than 50 miles
A few users feel the construction and mounting hardware are flimsy

customer_reviews.title: This antenna is very easy to put together and shipping was fast
customer_reviews.text: Was originally going to install this antenna outside but decided to install it in the attic instead to avoid outside elements. It is currently connected to 2 TVs and it picked up 38 OTA channels..The channels on the TVs are very clear and there has been no issues with reception. This antenna is very easy to put together and shipping was fast.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing results with this antena
customer_reviews.text: I placed it on the roof and connected to the coaxial cable after I disconnected the dish from Direct TV. I ran the auto search on the TV and I couldn't believe how many crystal clear channels it picked up. Now I can watch all the Sunday NFL games on the network channels and so much more. The towers are 60 or 70 miles from my house. I had tried one of those flat indoor antennas but it didn't work at all. This one is great and I didn't even connect the booster. I couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: GMier

customer_reviews.title: 2nd purchase and still great
customer_reviews.text: I sold the house I put his on over a year ago and left the antenna for the new owner. Purchased another one because the installation was flawless, and it worked better than I expected. The new installation is working perfectly and getting way more channels than the FCC map says I should get. And this is not some huge monstrosity of an antenna. Sized right, visually appealing and functional. What more could you want?
customer_reviews.author: Mike R.

customer_reviews.title: Very susceptible to electrical noise
customer_reviews.text: When it works, it works great. Unfortunately, turning various electronics on in the house kills the signal - for example, the LED lights in my garage, which sits a floor below and on the same side of the hose as the antenna mounted on the roof. I tried moved the power injector further down the line and away from those lights, and put it on a power filter. Now there seems to be some other unknown electronic device that kills the signal, and I'm even worse off. Since the power filter did not help it must be RF noise.
customer_reviews.author: N. Erath

customer_reviews.title: It's showtime!
customer_reviews.text: This deal is HUGE! As everyone I'm tired of paying so much for TV. I have to laugh that I completely forgot about TV transmission towers and believed the world was a cable only enviroment. I set this antenna up in 10 minutes after prepping the battlefield (wiring rooms). The antennas are 42 miles from my house and I now recieve 32 channels in crystal clear quality! ABC, CBS, NBC, and many more. Netflix is my entertainment but I wanted live local news without cable. I have been bragging all day at work....it seems everyone has forgotten about the old antenna. Outstanding product in quality, performance, and price!
customer_reviews.author: Brian Ages

customer_reviews.title: Strong signal works great 👍
customer_reviews.text: Great antenna. Mounted this antenna hanging off the trusses. Tried mounting it upright but being approximately 3”lower in height made all the difference in the world. Received 54 channels on 4 TVs definitely need the amplifier to make that happen. Also surround sound is working fine recieving 5.1 Dolby sound over the air. My Stations are all within 25 miles but still decided on long range antenna due to wanting to have good signal on 4 TVs. All TVs do have individual cable runs to each room so your results may vary. Great picture and an antenna I can recommend.
customer_reviews.author: JMac

customer_reviews.title: This was our third attempt to find an antenna that was inexpensive but put out a good picture that didn't pixolate
customer_reviews.text: OMG! This was our third attempt to find an antenna that was inexpensive but put out a good picture that didn't pixolate. This was the answer to our prayers. We mounted it on 20 feet of chain link poles at the corner of the house and we now have double the stations and a marvelous picture all the time. We are surrounded by trees and have had some terrible storms this week but the picture is always perfect no matter what channel we are watching. Never, never go back to cable! This is truly a wonderful antenna for the price and so easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: Deanne G McLean

customer_reviews.title: love it!
customer_reviews.text: 48 local HD channels, love it!! The only problem I had was with Fox network but that is because of the location of my house and where I install the antenna and all the threes that kinda block the signal... was getting 46 to 56 signal straight.... I added a 5ft extension ( Xtreme Signal SSMAST5 5-Feet Swedged Antenna Mast) and problem solved. Photo is before installing the extension
customer_reviews.author: Gus.P.

customer_reviews.title: Does not work as described.
customer_reviews.text: The description on Amazon lists the range as 85 to 100 miles. The box in which the antenna arrived says "up to 85 miles". I would not have made the purchase as I am 80 or so miles from the desired broadcast towers. After several attempts to scan for available channels and finding none at all, I will be returning the antenna and hope the statement in the product description promising the ability to return is true. This device may work at closer ranges but not as described. I am quite disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: SL

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't live up to its hype
customer_reviews.text: Purchased,installed within 2 days of receipt. Installed in the attic following inbox directions. TV received less channels than with previous antenna despite several position changes, direct tv-antennae hookup, and rescanning with each position change. I didn't find this a suitable replacement for my original larger 2003 attic antennae. When I reattached the original antennae unit, TVs picked up more channels than before (still no NBC).
customer_reviews.author: Momof2boys

customer_reviews.title: Hit And Miss
customer_reviews.text: Hit and Miss... I'm not sure I'm getting 85 miles out of this, but it does pull in stations better than any other antenna I have used. We are located in a service hole of sorts. Most cord-cutters in my area are doing large roof-top array antennas. This is obviously much smaller and more directional. For what it is / it's value point, it does a good job. If I lived closer to a major metro area, I bet this would be killer. But like I stated, we are kind of in a service hole at the moment.
customer_reviews.author: Doc1

customer_reviews.title: Avoid
customer_reviews.text: What a load of junk. How so many people rate this so high is beyond me. I’ve owned atleast 3 antennas at this exact same location and by far this is the worst of them all. Went from 8 Chns to just one.
customer_reviews.author: Average-Joe

customer_reviews.title: Cut the Cable or Satellite Dish Addiction
customer_reviews.text: The antenna works well. Setup was a bit tricky since directional accuracy is pretty important. You need to find “true north” in order to properly locate the right orientation for signal reception. I was having difficulty until I figured out that I was using magnetic north which was about 15 degrees off for my location. There are some good apps for this. I still see some digital drop-out depending upon weather, but I have a lot of tall trees between my property and the signal towers. I installed my antenna outside because a solar panel installation on my roof blocks access for an attic installation.
customer_reviews.author: Steve G.

customer_reviews.title: Works great at 40-50 Miles in the DFW area - HOWEVER
customer_reviews.text: Very nice, small and little weight...works extremely well at 45-55 Miles in the DFW area - HOWEVER, you need to do some research about how this works. The amplifier actually caused a couple of the stronger channel signals not to work. Additionally, a coax splitter can degrade the signal a bit. It is best to first test the antenna directly connected to one TV without any amplifier/splitter. Then start adding the additional components one at a time testing for best results. In my case, no amplifier was necessary even with a 3-way splitter. The amplifier actually disrupted the Fox channel signals. I ended up with 51 HD channels, including all main local/national broadcast channels...good luck!
customer_reviews.author: Baby mamma

customer_reviews.title: Wickenburg is a good 70 miles from Phoenix transmitters
customer_reviews.text: Wickenburg is a good 70 miles from Phoenix transmitters. This very small antenna does a super job receiving all channels. We are very happy with the performance. But sometime this Spring the amplifier failed inside the antenna. 1byOne was extra cooperative with a replacement. They selected a different style with no amplifier that ultimately outperforms the original. We had questions of the replacement and 1byOne was very informative with all the answers we needed. Delivery was prompt, assembly was simple and successful and the performance is excellent. After a few months of service, we are very happy with the antenna and 1byOne. Chamar
customer_reviews.author: chamar

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied with this small antenna. Mounted on Direct Tv mount with minor mod.
customer_reviews.text: 68 channels with antennas 50 miles away. I was able to install using and existing direct tv antenna mount but I had to do a minor mod. The mount bracket is actually two 8.8 full threaded screws. If you open the antenna box (about 6 screws) you can easily replace the screws with longer ones so it can fit the direct tv mount. Short trip to Lowe’s and $2 later I have a perfectly mounted antenna using the existing coaxial cables from the direct tv installation. Also make sure you use the provided amplifier and make sure it’s turned on.
customer_reviews.author: Ismael A. Roman

customer_reviews.title: Really brings in the stations
customer_reviews.text: Antenna performance is extremely location dependent. Your results may vary. I replaced an older amplified attic antenna with this and am really impressed with its performance. It is short enough to easily mount on a rotor in an attic. I used the curved post it came with in a backward fashion so that the rotor sits under the center of the antenna boom, requiring only about a foot and a half of clearance to rotate 360 degrees. The antenna works great and the included hardware is very useful. It should last a good long time in the protection of an attic.
customer_reviews.author: SJ Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Awesome antenna
customer_reviews.text: I love this antenna. I wanted to replace a flat panel antenna we had in a window that worked good for most channels but needed constant adjustment for a few channels. I have it mounted in my attic and used antennaweb.org website to find the direction of the signals. I used the compass on my phone to point it in that direction. Most of my signals are 40-50 miles away and I get all of them in perfect HD clarity. It was easy to setup and install. I have not had to adjust it since installing it and I have not had any issues with it after 8 months.
customer_reviews.author: MonkeyJJ

customer_reviews.title: At 30 miles it works good
customer_reviews.text: We are 30 miles from the farthest tv tower and we have full signal bars at the tv. Network stations are clear. We are in a valley and our antenna is pointed thru some trees on a mast outside our house which is about 6ft above the roof line. The mount is adjustable and does not need to be mounted specifically on the post that come with it, my mast is 1 1/4 chain link fence top rail and this fit great, it will fit on smaller and bigger posts. I would recommend this antenna.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Good antenna for the price
customer_reviews.text: I probably can't give the most credible review since I sit down in a valley under two mountains with this antenna. I am able to reach one Tower, however if you are in the flat you could do much better than I do. My only caution is that the bracket that attaches to the pole is made out of plastic. I broke mine during installation in which I did drop the antenna and broke the bracket. Fix it back together with a couple zip ties and went about business.
customer_reviews.author: RodneyG

customer_reviews.title: Small, and very effective for my application.
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for an antenna that was not too big, for a roof-mount installation. I ended up using a different pole (1 7/8" diameter) and base because I needed something taller. Beware if you go with this large of a pole, the bracket that holds the actual antenna on will no longer fit, as it's designed for a 1" diameter pole. I hacked the plastic part of my bracket up a bit, and it ultimately works just fine. The antenna picks up UHF/VHF stations for me that are 27-30 miles away, with 70-98% signal quality. So, I'm happy with this reception and get no dropouts. I'm using with a Silicondust HDHomeRun Extend, and very satisfied with this combo.
customer_reviews.author: Sam S.

customer_reviews.title: Buying My 4th One!
customer_reviews.text: This antenna is great. Crystal clear picture and sound. Installation can be very easy (I'm a former cable tech so my installation was more advanced than the instructions direct) and connection is simple. I've had such a great experience this will be my FOURTH purchase. I've installed these in both of my parents homes and I'm about to install one at my work. I've had zero issues with any of the installs I've done and they're all still working great!
customer_reviews.author: Zach Pierson

customer_reviews.title: Works great with long cable run
customer_reviews.text: I have a lake house that that sits close to the water in a cove with almost no cell reception. I decided to put in a cell phone signal booster through existing conduit. I thought I would roll the dice and see if I could get TV reception as well. The run from the top of the hill to the house is 350 ft. I used RG-11 cable and followed the recommendations per TV Fool. My distance to the TV broadcasters is about 38 miles. I put the antenna on a 15 mast and got clear reception of every channel TV fool indicated I could receive.
customer_reviews.author: Suz C

customer_reviews.title: somewhat protected from the elements) and it's still working fine, so there is something to be said for ...
customer_reviews.text: Works well! I can finally get those couple OTA channels I was missing (ABC, FOX). I wish it was held onto the rod with metal instead of plastic. I fell a tree nearby and it brushed the antenna on the way down and broke the plastic all to hell. I epoxy glued it back together but the stress of weight hanging makes the epoxy flex too much. I need some stiffer glue. In the meantime, the antenna is mounted upside-down on the rod, haha! Rain is hitting the coax connection directly (instead of being on the underside, somewhat protected from the elements) and it's still working fine, so there is something to be said for that I guess.
customer_reviews.author: SuperSnake

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I live about 80 miles from the stations and I did not use the included signal amplifier. I use this antenna and Amazon Stick for all of my TV. This antenna is easy to instal. I was going to put it on a long pole but when I first tested in in the house I was getting reception as I raised it above floor level toward the ceiling, So I mounted it on the roof eve with the enclosed mounting bracket and it works great!
customer_reviews.author: Raymond F. Hendrix

customer_reviews.title: This antenna worked fine for 7 months
customer_reviews.text: This antenna worked fine for 7 months. Now it continually gives an intermittent signal. The picture freezes often, pix-elates and then the screen says "no signal." I've had 3 TV's hooked up ever since I purchased it with no issues. Now all 3 TV's have the same issues and all connections were verified as good since the problem began. JUNK! Very disappointed! UPDATE: After posting a ONE star review here customer service contacted me and promptly sent out a replacement antenna free of charge. That's the way to do business...THANKS!
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Works better than expected
customer_reviews.text: We live in the suburbs of Milwaukee, about 20 to 25 miles from the three major broadcast towers. I am receiving 59 channels, all at or near 100 % signal strength on the TV's signal meter. The image quality is very good. I mounted the antenna in the attic of my one story garage, ran the wire down the wall through the foundation into the basement and came up through a cold air return behind the TV. The run is 50 ft. I installed the supplied amplifier at the back of the TV just before the input jack. It was much easier to power behind the TV vs. at the antenna. Over all I am very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Repairman

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised
customer_reviews.text: I have to admit, I really didn't expect much from this for the price. We live in Western Arkansas, and the transmitters for our OTA stations are strong but dealing with mountain terrain. First antenna we bought was a dismal failure. This little thing brings in stations I didn't know existed! The stations are at least as clear as cable- and saves me $50/mo paying for local cable + box rental.
customer_reviews.author: Wes

customer_reviews.title: Nice solid signal
customer_reviews.text: This replaced my amplified original home built bow tie. My old friend Corrosion had won, and I needed something new. This antenna met my expectations, based upon reviews. Nice solid signal, currently mounted at 8' and receiving through the house. The station 46 miles away comes in like the one 27 miles away. The 43-mile signal is too weak, but when I mount it at 30' it should work. I'm happy with the results. And for any of you researching devices, don't get lost in "digital" claims--it's all electromagnetic radiation. A larger, more complex antenna won't do any better than this one, unless it rotates. It's a solid buy.
customer_reviews.author: Jonesey Juryrigger

customer_reviews.title: Could be what you need
customer_reviews.text: Well made with quality materials. Might work for you. However, for me it brought me up from 14 channels to 22 channels and none of them were the primary channels. I went to an RCA yagi and instantly had nearly 60 channels solidly in place. I returned this one.
customer_reviews.author: W. B.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install Small Compact Antenna Still Pulled in 46 channels out in my rural area.
customer_reviews.text: This is a good directional antenna but I expected a bit more for the 85 mile range claim. It pulled in about 46 channels mounted 8 feet above my roof, compared to the Clearview 2V which pulled in 52. The 2V claims a 60 mile range. I bet if you had 2 of these pointing in different directions and tied to a splitter, the signal gain would be better. IMO the 2V is the superior hdtv antenna, but this simple and relatively small antenna does a good job. Installation was very easy, and it comes assembled. All you have to do is mount it.
customer_reviews.author: Old Man Muscles

customer_reviews.title: I just plain like to watch regular T
customer_reviews.text: I just plain like to watch regular T.V. Somebody stole my cheap indoor HD antennae." I'm not mad." I thought. "That one didn't get a lot of channels and the signal would freak out and that was driving me nuts." I got this one and installed it onto the side of my house. My internet/ cable company associate at their payment center had offered me complimentary cable wire before. So I asked. They gave me a little piece. WOW! I scanned for channels and now have a whole bunch! The signal is always strong and clear! I hope whoever stole my old one goes completely nuts trying to watch T>V> like I used to! Thx!
customer_reviews.author: charles d.

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: Just received this antenna today. No assembly needed. Very easy to put on my rv (which I live in). My old antenna received just 30 stations, this one receives 45. All in 1080HD. Fantastic antenna. Just an FYI, I only live 25 miles or less from the stations I receive.
customer_reviews.author: dpw49

customer_reviews.title: Very lightweight
customer_reviews.text: After 20 years my huge old monster-sized antenna needed replacing. I love the small profile of this one and now I get a much clearer and brighter picture and I am able to bring in 10 additional stations that I could not receive with the old one. Excellent price, too. With the booster box, the installer had to do additional wiring so it was not a quick install. We'll have to see how well it withstands the harsh weather we get here.
customer_reviews.author: Creaky

customer_reviews.title: Great little antenna
customer_reviews.text: I had an indoor antenna before and had issues with reception and pixelation late in the afternoons, so I searched for a small outdoor one and this one hit the mark. I did have to modify the mount for the pole because I bolted it to my fascia board and the antenna was pointing more downward. Once I made the modification all the channels came in great and I have had no more reception issues. Even kept good signal strength during a recent thunder storm. I did buy a surge protector to add to the line coming into the house just in case of any lightening strikes.
customer_reviews.author: USNTRON

customer_reviews.title: Pretty impressive
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure if I'd trust putting this antenna outside, but I would use it in an attic with no issue. It's not large and bulky and doesn't feel like it can stand the test of weather, but once assembled, it gave me more channels than any of the 3 antennas I purchased previously.
customer_reviews.author: HonestlySpeakingDez

customer_reviews.title: Goodbye to channels we pay for and never watch!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Live 35 miles north of St. Louis, MO. Antenna pulls 53 channels and works really good so far. I bolted the pole right to the bracket on the roof from the Dish (dumped the Dish and the $100 bill) Good product, good price. This is amplified and you will need to connect the power supply to house power to run the amp inline.
customer_reviews.author: JustLiftTheWeights

customer_reviews.title: Works fairly good. However
customer_reviews.text: Works fairly good. However, it depends on how far you are from the stations. It doesn't cover 85 miles like it says. May 14, 2018 - after my review, 1Byone customer service contacted me. They have been extremely helpful and patient helping me obtaining better reception. After multiple emails, they are sending me another more powerful antenna. Excellent customer service makes it all worthwhile.
customer_reviews.author: H. Ringley

customer_reviews.title: ... couldn't pick up and the picture quality was no better. I could see no difference in picture quality ...
customer_reviews.text: It didn't pick up any new stations and there was still some pixelation. I was contacted with the seller who helped me review the broadcast channels in my area. The seller provided me with a different antenna which was more suited for my geographical area. It indeed worked better. I understand now that the problem is due to the low broadcast signal strength in my area and my need to have the antenna be indoors I was impressed by the seller's responsiveness to deal with my problem.
customer_reviews.author: DENNIS M.

customer_reviews.title: Good reception in spite of trees
customer_reviews.text: I am pulling down over a dozen stations and the picture quality is excellent for over half of them. There's a 70 ft. tree in the line of sight with my primary tower but it is about 200 feet away, so the antenna still grabs an adequate signal and the 20 degree off-axis tower signals are still reliable. Installation is straight forward with optional antenna mounting configurations. Overall, a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Beemer geek

customer_reviews.title: Very Impressive
customer_reviews.text: Upon reading the reviews and one being in my area, I decided to give this antenna a try for $50. I couldn't be any more pleased with it. I'm picking up channels in the 95-100 mile range that are in the same direction as the locals I was aiming for and I'm getting the New Orleans stations which are directly behind where I have this aimed. Do yourself a favor and buy this little guy. It is very small and super impressive!! Picture clarity on the HD stations is better than what I had with cable.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Hansen

customer_reviews.title: Expensive - doesn't work very well.
customer_reviews.text: I live 10 miles from downtown Seattle and three large TV broadcast towers so you would think I could get excellent reception using this antenna. Well that isn't the case. Made direction adjustments, got new hi-quality Co-Ax cable, but still not getting many stations. If it's windy or raining the HD stations pix-elate. My $12 dollar flat HD antenna stuck in my living room works better than this thing. I gave it a couple of weeks but I can't recommend. Very disappointed, It's going back.
customer_reviews.author: Jekemi

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: We temporarily hooked this up to one of our TV's just to see how many channels it would pull in. We did mount it outside on the same post our direct tv dish is on. It pulled in 44 channels with most being HD. We put it on top of the TV stand on the other TV to see what it did and it pulled in 29 channels being in the house. We are very pleased with this product and after much research we feel we made the right choice. Ready to shut off the direct tv.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Who needs cable?
customer_reviews.text: I removed my satellite dish and mounted the antenna on the satellite dish post. I downloaded a free app for my smart phone, to know which direction to point the antenna, scanned for channels and right away had 64 perfectly clear channels. Who needs cable?
customer_reviews.author: Brian Cranfill

customer_reviews.title: Works great.  Very happy.  TVs are crystal clear.  140+ Ft RG6 + 4 way splitter
customer_reviews.text: Antenna works great. I have it installed in my garage attic. TV towers are 15-20 Miles all within a few degrees. I have 75 feet RG6 cable then connected to power adapter then 4 way splitter that drops -7dB. TVs are connected via RG6 cable ranging from 15ft to 70 additional feet beyond splitter. Using TiVo receivers and signal is 72 to 90s depending on channel. Very happy so far.
customer_reviews.author: M2

customer_reviews.title: great product for cable cutters
customer_reviews.text: I am more than happy with this product.I live 50 miles away from the broadcast area and i receive 40 clear channels. A web site i checked with said that i could expect 8 channels with a 30 foot pole. I installed it just below the roof of my house. Went inside to run cannel search sand was blown away. It sure made life easier since i just cut the pay tv cord. I have told my neighbors about this product and they are thinking about doing the same thing.
customer_reviews.author: orange rider

customer_reviews.title: 30 mile antenna, not 85
customer_reviews.text: I read reviews on a website boasting this to be the best antenna... this claims to pick up stations 80 miles away; it doesn’t. It does not even pick up ones from 45 miles away. I’m disappointed, I already had an antenna for my local stations and was trying to pick up more from a different direction and distance, it was a waste of money for me. I picked up no extra stations from those towers. Maybe you’ll have better luck than me, I’d say this has a 30 mile range.
customer_reviews.author: Janet

customer_reviews.title: easy installation and great reception
customer_reviews.text: I live about 35 miles from Austin Tx out in the Texas hill country and get 28 usable channels. I mounted the antenna on the side of my two story house pointed towards Austin. it took several attempts to fine tune the direction of the antenna to get the channels I preferred. The size of antenna is good in that it does not draw attention to it.
customer_reviews.author: spicewoodtx

customer_reviews.title: so I'm happy about that
customer_reviews.text: Was able to pick up additional channels over the 80 mile 1Byone model I had before. Now I get all the major networks, so I'm happy about that. The 80 mile model I had before went out after a year and I've gotten no response from 1Byone support, so that's not a great sign in regards to customer satisfaction. Hopefully this antenna lasts longer.
customer_reviews.author: Luke W.

customer_reviews.title: Works great, long range
customer_reviews.text: Easily installed, works great. I put it in my attic & have had no trouble. Sustituted a multi-channel amp to get additional connections. Luckily for me, the transmitters for the channels I watch are close to each other & I don't need to adjust the antenna direction for various channels. I can get channels from almost 90 miles or so on a good day
customer_reviews.author: Steve Hablitzel

customer_reviews.title: Easy to adapt to a dish pole ----
customer_reviews.text: It would have been nice if the screws were 1/4 - 3/8 longer so it could easily replace a dish (their mast in 1/4 bigger diameter) and you'll see many complained of this - SIMPLE solution - take the back half of the clamp off and pry out the metal bracket and toss the plastic part. You'll gain 3/8 of an inch and it fits a standard dish pole with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Tango John

customer_reviews.title: this antenna works good and provides a great signal
customer_reviews.text: this antenna works good and provides a great signal, I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 because I actually have a !byone indoor flat antenna that picks up a few more stations and it just sits on the shelf next the the TV. I mounted it on my roof but it may get better reception if I moved it up a little higher maybe to the center of the roof. I will update after I move the antenna if it changes
customer_reviews.author: ian

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to install on the roof of our home, a one man job! The antenna was light weight and came with everything included, except the few tools it took to install. It did take a little of time to zero in on the correct location to pick up all of our local TV stations. Sure is great not having to pay a satellite bill. I would recommend this antenna to anyone, as it can be mounted/installed in a variety of places.
customer_reviews.author: pla

customer_reviews.title: provided terrible reception. I was using an antenna (mounted in ...
customer_reviews.text: Product didn't work...provided terrible reception. I was using an antenna (mounted in the roof trusses of my garage) that promoted a 60 mile range (I'm located about 35 miles from the majority of the broadcast stations over rolling hills type terrain) that gives excellent performance except for one (ABC) station that I'm wanting to pick up. In comparison (marketing literature), this antenna had a longer range capability...certainly didn't demonstrate it. Got some level of pixilation on all broadcast stations. I shipped the unit back and went back to the previous antenna model.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Zager

customer_reviews.title: Great antenna
customer_reviews.text: Cut the cable company and wanted my local channels. I am in the suburbs and 25-40 miles from the towers. trees everywhere. I tried an omnidirectional antenna, paid more for that on than this one, and it didn't pick up all the channels I wanted, so I bought this one. This antenna works great for me. I needed a directional antenna to point at the city and this baby did the trick very nicely. I get 30 plus channels crystal clear, very happy.
customer_reviews.author: William P. George

customer_reviews.title: A perfectly clear powerhouse
customer_reviews.text: This antenna is a godsend. I live adequately north of the city so all the stations are in on directional area. This picks up ALL of them. It was super easy to mount on the side of my roof. Very easy to assemble. No interference, nothing. And it really isn't that much of an eyesore. I've used other antennas like Mohu and some Walmart brand, but this was cheaper and beats them out in terms of power any day.
customer_reviews.author: Regdab

customer_reviews.title: Don't make size of it fool you
customer_reviews.text: When package arrived I felt like there was useless toy in the box. I was wrong. With this antenna I can pick weak channels 60 miles away and it is compact size and very easy to install. I hope it will survive Alaskan winter. AAA+++
customer_reviews.author: oldfart

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Simple setup and install. I replaced a 60-mile Mohu antenna with this 1byone. So far, it is working well and delivering a consistent number of channels. In the short time I have owned this antenna, it has seen sun, clouds, rain, and snow; no problems! Obviously the weather can have some impact, but I have had the TV on through it all. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Nick W.

customer_reviews.title: Good product, works well
customer_reviews.text: The only reason I have not given a 5 for picture quality, is I have not had a chance to tweek the direction for the best picture signal. We live 54 miles North of Downtown Houston in the Piney Woods, our house is surrounded by trees. Using TV Fool . Com I set the direction in accordance with his info, picked up17 channels most of which are watchable, however some are not ie maybe 6. Had to purchase a converter to convert antenna cable from regular to HDMI. Satisfied Customer.
customer_reviews.author: Malcolm  D Drinkwater

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, inexpensive, directional antenna, works for me in hilly forested area for stations 45mi away
customer_reviews.text: This allows me to augment my streaming with OTA for viewing local channels. I live in a hilly area about 45 mi to a concentration of TV towers. All of the local channels come in very clear with no pixilation. It's mounted in my attic, and the area is heavily wooded. If the area was flat, I'm certain it would pick up stations much farther away. This antenna is somewhat directional, my stations are fortunately all located in the same general direction.
customer_reviews.author: Gimpy

customer_reviews.title: Best one, compact, sturdy and pulls in the channels
customer_reviews.text: I am 48 miles from where my local channels broadcast. I was able to tune In 25 channels including All the networks, ABC,NBC,CBS & FOX. I mounted it on an outside wall using an old Satellite J-Mount & existing cable wires, quick install. I did not try it in my attic but it should also work there as well ? This antenna is simple and constructed better then most of those so called 150 mile antennas. Great buy!!
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: If you have a Dish mount on your house..
customer_reviews.text: Great antenna, needed this to get "channel 4" in Nashville TN. (UHF ... something, something...). Now I get two "channel 4's" (the other's from Bowling Green). If you have a Dish mount on your house you can take their grey jpole (and it's supports) off of the mount base and make it work with the black jpole that comes with this antenna. The sides of the black jpole won't actually touch the grey mount base when you're finished (try to center it though) but that shouldn't matter if you do it right. Remember, it's not supporting that sail of a dish anymore - this antenna is pretty small so it's not going to catch very much wind.
customer_reviews.author: David James Sullenbarger

customer_reviews.title: Great Reception and Design
customer_reviews.text: Great reception and good design. I received every channel possible when first putting it up, however a 2 story house was built across the street directly in the path of the broadcast antennas. I only lost a couple of weak stations that I don't watch anyway. This is without even using the amplifier. Compact and modern design.
customer_reviews.author: LEAFican

customer_reviews.title: The New Version has Less then 1/2 gain rating.
customer_reviews.text: They have changed the antenna. The one I recieved was not the one in the picture. On the box it even says max gain is 5-9 and 7-10 do. Returned for false advertising. Updated with pictures to show actual antenna and actual gain ratings.
customer_reviews.author: RJ Smith

customer_reviews.title: Attached to Old Dish and works perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I put this on our old dish antenna, and just rewired a new cable from the antenna to the Dish junction box a few feet away under the eve and ran the electrical wire into the attic. Plugged the dish coax cables into the coax plug on the back of my TVs and they all work! We have 48 channels now and many are in beautiful HD! works perfectly for us!
customer_reviews.author: R. Ray

customer_reviews.title: Only Clear Skies!
customer_reviews.text: For the money a pretty good antenna. Easy install and it performs pretty well. My 3 star rating because I live within 25 miles from my towers and as soon as it gets a little cloudy it loses half the stations. Bottom line, if not clear skies every day, try something else.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Fraser

customer_reviews.title: Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.text: I used this to replace a different antenna I had and it works perfectly. Most the the source points are over 45 miles away and this gets all my locals crystal clear. I have it setup in the rafters of my garage and then to a 4-way splitter. All the tv's get everything well. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Boaty McBoatface

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Good not Great
customer_reviews.text: Installations worked great, I hooked it up to my old splitter from DirecTv. All but 1 channel comes in clear all the time, that channel is about 43 miles away. Otherwise I get 17 channels that are all around that 40(ish) miles away. The channels that are further away (around 70-80 miles away) do not come in very clearly so I wouldn't say the 85 mile range is fully accurate. I do live in a low-lying area so that could be the major cause of the not full range, but overall I think it was a very good value and it works as I expected or a little better even.
customer_reviews.author: A.J. B

customer_reviews.title: I put the in-line amp at the cable junction and splitter box to split the signal to four rooms and it is working great. Replaced DirecTV with OTA Antenna plus Sling box
customer_reviews.text: Antenna mounting was simple. I drilled couple of holes on the DirecTV dish mast and mounted it and used the cable from the dish to connect to the antenna. I put the in-line amp at the cable junction and splitter box to split the signal to four rooms and it is working great. Replaced DirecTV with OTA Antenna plus Sling box. Very happy with performance of 1by One antenna and the Cable Converter Box to record the channels.
customer_reviews.author: Nate Bhadriraju

customer_reviews.title: I was skeptical but I am super happy with this Antenna.
customer_reviews.text: NO MORE CABLE! Super easy to install. I installed in the attic in 5 minutes with a few screws. I plugged it into the cable splitter as I dont have cable any more. Now all of the cable jacks in the house have a great antenna. I get a few more channels than I did with the plastic window antenna and the quality reception is considerably better. I use this and a KODI tv box and I will never have cable again.
customer_reviews.author: MrWhite

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: The antenna is fiddly -- very sensitive to weather conditions the signal distorts badly when aircraft pass overhead. (We live 15 to 35 miles from TV transmitters.) Required frequent adjustments, and getting a clear signal on one channel meant giving up a clear signal on another. It finally stopped working altogether, but I think because of a lightning hit -- can't blame the manufacturer for that.
customer_reviews.author: J. Kent

customer_reviews.title: 1.5 years old still going strong! 58 channels in central MA with lots of woods
customer_reviews.text: We have been using this for a year and a half! Works excellent! It’s mounted outside on our house. Every so often you need to run a scan for new channels or maybe move it a few inches as things grow and change. We currently get 58 channels and we are located 1 hour from Boston with a lot of trees around us.
customer_reviews.author: P. Fraser

customer_reviews.title: Great antenna and a Great price
customer_reviews.text: Right out of the box this antenna worked GREAT. The quality of the signal and the number of stations that it was able to pull in far exceeded my expectations. I would strongly recommend this antenna to anyone in need of a antenna for receiving local digital TV.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Really Works
customer_reviews.text: Works very well. We are in a very low spot, yet it pulled in all of the local digital stations, plus some in a different state we did not expect to get. Now we can dump the local channels from our satellite package.
customer_reviews.author: relaxretired

customer_reviews.title: Great antenna.
customer_reviews.text: What a great antenna. It is quite small in size but the reception is fantastic. I get all 64 channels I had before with a much larger antenna at my old house. I had someone install it for me but he said it was very easy to install, and very light weight. We have had several strong wind storms and the antenna was not damaged and reception was still the same. I definitely recommend this antenna.
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Works, but not much of an improvement
customer_reviews.text: This unit has an advantage over other outdoor antennas because it is smaller and easier to install, but we have since obtained a couple of indoor antennas that are inconspicuous, easier to use, and result in better reception.
customer_reviews.author: D E Conner

customer_reviews.title: Works as Advertised
customer_reviews.text: Easy install. Its important to have a signal scanner to get the best setup. The further the tower/towers are from your location the more critical the aim. I moved mine as little as 1/16 of a inch to get the best signals for all towers. All the towers are in the same general direction from me so that helps. The towers that are close by are not a problem. I combined this antenna with a 4 tuner Tablo and it performs better then my Sattilite sevice did. Big savings now that I cut the cord.
customer_reviews.author: RMS

customer_reviews.title: Really good for UHF channels
customer_reviews.text: Really good antenna for UHF channels in Boston area. I was using the Mohu leaf and this one is major improvement. Signal is reliable and channels don't drop off during snow or rainy days. I have mounted it in Attic and connected to HDhomerun tuner for network access. Doesn't pick up VHF-Lo, but it is fine as I have that channel in UHF.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Incredible Reception
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a review writer, but I had to write one for this because this antenna is amazing. I live on the 5th floor of my building with a tree behind me which is to our roof, and there's no impact to its performance. Before I got this one I had another 1byone antenna which I bought 4 years ago, with a 60 mile range, and I thought that one was good - doesn't compare to this one; I even picked up 11 more channels. I thought the size might be too big, but it's a perfect size and fits great on my patio. You won't regret getting this one!
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Works great and easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Easy to install, came with everything needed and had TV immediately. We're on the east side of the Chesapeake Bay so we are now getting the DC and Baltimore local stations, In Total we get 25 stations from around the area. We also had to purchase and install a converter box as our motorhome had two analog TVs built in. Picture is really clear.
customer_reviews.author: audittlady

customer_reviews.title: Install. Search For Channels. Enjoy free TV programming.
customer_reviews.text: Simple set up. I choose to mount mine in the attic. I am on North East side of Dallas in Rowlett. Downloaded an app to help point in the antenna in the general direction of most of the TV towers. Ran the channel setup. 100 channels. I know I’ll probably just watch 10 or so. But I’m happy with this. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Goss

customer_reviews.title: Good bye cable...
customer_reviews.text: Packaged very well and easy to install. I mounted this on a rafter at the top of my attic space. Because of its compact size its easy to find a good location. Before I could only get 20 or so channels but with this I'm able to pull in 55 channels with a great picture. I'm in zip code 37122. My parents live in the middle of no where and I'm going to purchase another one to use there.
customer_reviews.author: jonC

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Picking up all the local channels. Couldn't use the supplied amp. It was too strong. I'm about 20 to 30 miles away from most towers. I purchased a less powereful amplified splitter (RCA) from Lowes. All are crystal clear.
customer_reviews.author: Scott K

customer_reviews.title: Works well inside
customer_reviews.text: Works great even inside the house. I tested the set up inside before mounting the unit and all my local channels were strong. For comparison I had a USB amplified "leaf" antenna and that would not pick up all my local stations.
customer_reviews.author: Brad C.

customer_reviews.title: Buy this antenna
customer_reviews.text: Very rarely do I write a review, but this product warrants one. I live in a location where it is very difficult to receive OTA signals due to surrounding hills. Our digital tuner has a signal meter and all antennas we have tried before this one result in 0-5 signal strength out of 100 (which is completely unusable). This baby gets me up into the 60+ range. I get all the major networks in my area and almost every other available channel in my area. The high ratings this antenna has received are definitely well deserved.
customer_reviews.author: GABE

customer_reviews.title: much better than the 60 mile indoor antenna we've been using
customer_reviews.text: Works well, much better than the 60 mile indoor antenna we've been using. We had been unable to pick up a UHF station 35 miles out no matter where we placed the indoor antenna, even trying it outside. We placed this one on our roof, plugged in the amplifier, and it worked with just a slight directional adjustment. The included amplifier states that it is for indoor use only. If you're planning to put it in the attic, that's not a big deal. However, it's advertised as an outdoor antenna so I would've expected a pre-amp that could handle the weather, otherwise I'd rate it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Jason E.

customer_reviews.title: Good quality modestly priced outdoor antenna
customer_reviews.text: As a recent 'cable cutter' who purchased the Tablo OTA dvr device, i found that this antenna was a perfect receptor for my Tablo device. Initially i wanted to mount this on the roof of my townhouse condo, but when that wasn't an option, i found the antenna worked just as well mounted ground level on a fence in my backyard.
customer_reviews.author: tanpan

customer_reviews.title: 38 miles is too far
customer_reviews.text: I know better but thought I'd give this a try. I get one channel from Chicago, 38 miles with a clear line of sight, outdoors under the eaves of a two-story house.
customer_reviews.author: EJ

customer_reviews.title: My search for new  antenna has ended!!
customer_reviews.text: Yes, I ended my search for a new antenna after I found this antenna. This thing is awesome. It comes fully assembled and the performance is out of this world. I had a mohu sky 60 for two years before it stopped working. With mohu, I had a total of 42 channels and only half of them were watchable. Now, I have stable and clear 59 channels. I never knew there were this many free channels on air. I highly recommend this antenna.
customer_reviews.author: Thyseer(Tulsa,OK)

customer_reviews.title: This antenna is simple to assembly and easy to mount
customer_reviews.text: This antenna is simple to assembly and easy to mount. I mounted this in my attic in less than 10 minutes. I live about 55 miles from the network antennas and I am able to get all of the channels clearly. This antenna comes with an amplifier that does require electricity.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Works good
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as part of myself cutting cable I Installed in my attic seems pics up at about 25 channels. I would not install it outside it did not seem like it would hold up to NYS Winters but that is just a though as i installed in my attic. I wish it would have come with 50 - 100 feet cable.
customer_reviews.author: Zman81

customer_reviews.title: I Love this product - GREAT  service
customer_reviews.text: This product is a sturdy antenna - very easy to install. The first time I did a channel search - 75 channels! Not bad for free😊 many of the stations I watch come in at 1080p. I put the antenna outside on the peak of my two story house. This gives me a direct 60 mile line of sight to the TV towers. No problem for this antenna is rated at 85 miles! I give customer service an A+. I had an issue with the power supply - 1 phone call later (never put on hold AND a real person answered) a new power supply arrived at my house. Just today I received an email thanking me for my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: J. L. Reed

customer_reviews.title: Issue with amplifier/power box
customer_reviews.text: There is something wrong with the amplifier box. If you even slightly touch the coax cable going into the amplifier/power box, the picture on the tv gets pixelated and choppy. Very frustrating. At first I thought it was the antenna itself, so I would reposition and rescan for channels. But within minutes, several channels would drop or become pixelated and unwatchable. Tried a different coax cable too, and same thing happens. If I tighten the coax cable all the way into the input I get no signal at all!
customer_reviews.author: Betty D

customer_reviews.title: Quick and dirty!
customer_reviews.text: WOW What a difference this inexpensive solution makes! Without climbing a 100 yards in the air and pointing an enormous structure in just the right position, we now get over 60 (all my locals and more) channels for free! FOOTBALL! The right way to situate this device is in the attic. There is NO other way. Heed the warning of other reviews and keep this baby out of the rain and moisture, this products delivers when it is used correctly; in a dry, protected environment. BUY IT!
customer_reviews.author: Sonny

customer_reviews.title: Easy assembly and install
customer_reviews.text: Been in use for about a week. Easy assembly and install. The plastic parts feel cheap and I am interested to see how it performs long term. I was up on the roof looking at it yesterday and it was solid despite moderate winds. The J pipe works well. At the price this is a great product. Amazon makes more sense for ordering this product than anywhere else at this time. Box stores can not compete with the quality and performance at this price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: I’ve tried several of these small amplified antennas. Most are junk. This one works. Time will tell how it holds up, but as far as reception, this unit has surpassed all others regardless of price range.
customer_reviews.author: D.A.Hoover

customer_reviews.title: Nothing at my house
customer_reviews.text: I was truly hoping this would work. I'm 40 miles away from the towers. Didn't pull in anything for me. Tried with and without amp. Nothing. I wanted this to work because it is light weight and compact. My search is on for something that will work for me. It might work in another application. Seems to be of quality material.
customer_reviews.author: Wazzucoug

customer_reviews.title: Marginally better than rabbit-ears
customer_reviews.text: Only NOMINALLY better than the 30”-span, ancient Rabbit-Ears antenna I’d been using before. I’m about 55 miles out from Manhattan, NYC, on Long Island, in a second-story apartment. This 1byone claims a range of 85 miles. Now, my “line of sight” could be better, as there are trees between me and NYC, but I really expected much better performance than 35-year-old, cheap, small Rabbit-Ears. Really...
customer_reviews.author: C. Fergo

customer_reviews.title: Good antenna
customer_reviews.text: For the price, it is great. I receive channels as far as 65 miles away, altogether 24 channels, depending where you live, you may receive few more or few less. I live in north west Mass and have mounted the antenna outside my second floor window. If you buy this antenna, try different locations around your house for best reception and always point it in the direction of the transmitting towers.
customer_reviews.author: DA

customer_reviews.title: Just ok
customer_reviews.text: I had very high expectations, since the reviews were so high. We get 1 maybe 2 local channels and a few other odd channels. Bought an amplifier to see if we could get more channels. No luck, will probably return.
customer_reviews.author: Lgates

product_meta.title: 1byone Rotating TV Antenna with 360 Degree Directional Receiving Signal, 80 Mile Enhanced Outdoor TV Antenna with Remote Control and 49.2ft High Performance Coaxial Cable
product_meta.description:
Style:Outdoor TV antenna with Remote Control1byone Outdoor Amplified Rotating HDTV Antenna

Our Enhanced Rotating Antenna is specially designed for receiving digital over-the-air (OTA) TV broadcasts from all your local television stations. So never pay hugely expensive cable or satellite fees again and get all your local channels in crystal clear quality, absolutely free!

360 Degree Rotating Antenna to solve the difficult problem of manually adjusting the antenna
Freely rotate 360 degree to pick up signals from any direction, so after installing the antenna, you can change its receiving direction simply by remote control, but not have to adjusting the mounting pole strenuously.

Infrared Remote Control for Antenna Adjustment
Are you troubled to adjust the antenna direction on the roof for better signal reception, especially on bad weather day? Now with this tv antenna, you will never have to do it again, just stay at home comfortably to adjust the antenna direction by the remote control.

TV Antenna Specifications:
Receiving Frequency: 170-230MHz; 470-862MHz
Receiving Range: VHF/UHF
Impedance:75Ω
Reception Range: 80 Miles
Beam Width: H60°/V60°
Power Input: AC-110V/60Hz
Power Output: AC15V 100mA
Coaxial Cable Length: 49.2ft

Locate Digital TV Broadcast Towers
The distance from the broadcast towers will vary based on the location of your home. Visit "tvfool" and enter your address or zip code for details about the towers near you. This information will assist in selecting the correct antenna model and aiming your antenna for the best results.

What you receive:

1x Rotating Antenna Main Unit with 49.2ft Coaxial Cable; 
1x UHF Enhanced Reception Loop; 
1x Pole Mounting Accessories; 
1x Power Supply Unit; 1x Remote Control （batteries not included); 
1x 5ft 3C 2V Coaxial Cable (From PSU to TV); 
3x Cable Ties; Instruction Manual.
feature_bullets: Free for Life - Never pay expensive cable or satellite fees again! 1byone HDTV Antenna can pull in all of your local news, weather, sitcoms, kids and sports programs absolutely FREE.
360 Degree Rotating Antenna - Freely rotate 360 degree to pick up signals from any direction, solving the difficult problem of manually adjusting the antenna.

Superior Simple and Light-weight Structure - this antenna is much lighter and simpler design comparing with traditional rotating antenna with heavy rotating head. Superior construction to withstand tough outdoor weather conditions.

Included Remote Control for Antenna Adjustment - No longer worry about trips outside in cold, raining, snowy, or windy weather to dangerously climb up and manually adjust the direction of your antenna. Simply adjust the antenna's direction from the comfort of inside your own home using the remote control.

The Best Picture and Sound Quality - You can now experience HDTV in the highest quality picture and sound available. Over-the-air broadcasts are transmitted in uncompressed full HD (1080P), ultra HD (4K), and 3D channels, far surpassing what cable and satellite offer. Many local broadcasts are digitally aired in Dolby 5.1 Surround Sound giving you the ultimate sound stage for watching live television.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars1,552 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
